availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas L. Rogers Wilson (Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer, Corporal (U.S.A.))

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer, Corporal (U.S.A.). Son of John M. Wilson and Anna Rogers Wilson. Married to Mary Jane Ladd Wilson in Roane, Tennessee on January 30, 1844. Father of Anna J. Wilson, John Wilson, Elizabeth Wilson, Margaret E. Wilson, Martha J. Wilson. School teacher in Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A) as Corporal from January to August 1862. Discharged at Louisville, Kentucy on August 27, 1862 on a surgeon's certificate.

ab.bibl:
